page.title: 13Traffic passing Kirkby C.E.
page.content: Our school is on a busy main road and on Tuesday 26th February 1985 some out of our class conducted a survey to find out the type of traffic that uses the road. I counted 365 cars and taxis, 25 buses, 73 lorries and vans, 25 motor bikes and bicycles and 10 other types of vehicle. We started the count at 1.40 p.m. and finished at 2.20.p.m. We used a tally chart to mark down the number of vehicles we counted. When we got back to school some of the people who had been counting the traffic made a graph to show our results. They cut out small cars to show the number of cars, small lorries for the number of lorries and so on. Each shape on the graph stood for 10 vehicles. When the graph was finished people could easily see the wide variety of traffic passing our school.
